activities.loc: Courtroom D, Fourth Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Pedro Julio Rodriguez

records.addlTxt: 1:41 PM Defendant Pedro Julio Rodriguez appeared by phone.  Prosecuting attorney Emmeline Lee appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn Spanish interpreter Victor Gonzalez appeared by video as interpreter for defendant. Defendant to file petition for court appointed attorney. Matter to be set for indigency hearing.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
No violent or disorderly conduct with victim: A.S.

1:27 PM Defendant Pedro Julio Rodriguez appeared by phone.  Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn Spanish interpreter Sally Nichols appeared as interpreter for defendant. Defendant address and date of birth verified. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond set of $1000 with conditions. No violent or disorderly conduct with victim: A.S. Defendant to sign bond by 10/21/2022.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
